1.text: Pick flowers that haven't fully bloomed yet.

2.text: Remove excess leaves and cut the stems down to size.

3.text: Bind your flowers together with string or a rubber band.

4.text: Hang the flowers upside-down in a cool, dark place.

5.text: Take the flowers down when the stems snap easily.

6.text: Pick fresh flowers and remove any leaves you don't want to preserve.

7.text: Place the flowers in a microwave-safe bowl filled with silica sand.

9.text: Microwave the flowers for 2-3 minutes for 30 seconds at a time.

10.text: Leave the flower in the silica sand for a day.

11.text: Choose freshly-picked flowers with separated petals.

12.text: Set up a cold water bath and drying station.

14.text: Melt paraffin wax mixed with mineral oil in the boiler or cooker.

15.text: Dip the flowers one at a time in the wax for 1 second.

16.text: Place the flower immediately into the cold water bath.

17.text: Allow the flower to dry on the parchment paper.

18.text: Spritz your dried flowers with a little bit of hairspray.

19.text: Fill a jar with different-colored buds for a simple, elegant display.

20.text: Use a single color of flower for a monochromatic look.

21.text: Place a single flower in a small jar for a minimalist look.

22.text: Pull the petals off of the flower to create a confetti display.

24.text: Finish your display off with a bow made of twine.
